entry.title: 油漆TDS
entry.content:
AkzoNobel

BCCC

10P20-44MN(FHigh Solids Epoxy Primer)

​   Characteristics       - A high solids urethane compatible, Skydrol resistant primer for application
​       Product         - to aircraft exterior surfaces. 10P20-44MNF provides excellent corrosion
​       Information         protection and optimizes the system adhesion of the exterior decoration
                      finish.

​   Components
​       Curing Solution,      Curing Solution EC-291B
​       Thinner/Reducer     Thinner TR-102 (for use where VOC control is not required)
​                   Thinner TR-102 (for use where VOC control is not required)

​   Instruction for Use

​       Mixing Ratio     2 parts     Base 10P20 44MNF
​       (volume)        1 parts     Curing Solution EC-291B

​                  1 parts     Thinner TR-114* or TR-102*

​       Initial Spraying     13 - 16 seconds Zahn-Cup 2 (2:1:1 mix ratio)

​       Viscosity         15 - 25 seconds ISO-Cup 4 (2:1:1 mix ratio)

​       (25°C/77°F)

​       Pot L ife     4 hours.
​       (25°C/77°F)

​       Dry Film     15 - 25 micron (um)
​       Thickness     0.6- 0.9 mils
​       (DFT)

​   Application Recommendations

​       Temperature:       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:     35- 75%

Aerodur_3001 （High Solids Base Coat）

​   Characteristics      - Aerodurs 3001 is a chemically cured, long life base coat for use in a base
​               coat / clear coat system formulated to provide uniform coverage and
             appearance in one box coat application.

​     Product       - When used with AkzoNobel Aerospace primers; 37098 (AIMS 04.04.013),
​     Information     37 124 (AIMS04 .04.031),10P20-44 (BMS 10-79 Type |I & II), 10P20-44M or
             10P20-44MNF (BMS 10-72 Type IX), or 10P20-12 (DMS 2104) and the
             specified Aerodur- 3002 polyurethane clear topcoat, 3002G00002, this
             system provides a durable long lasting, protective and decorative finish that
             exceeds typical OEM requirements for exterior aircraft performance.

            - Aerodur 3001, in combination with the specified Aerodur 3002 clear coat
             provides reduced cycle time and superior chemical and stain resistance,
             and weathering performance.

​   Components
​     Base Coat          3001GXXXXX
​     Curing Solution     CS6000
​     Activator       A900X*

​   Instruction for Use

​     Mixing Ratio     6 parts     Base 3001GXXXXX
​     (volume)        1 parts     Curing Solution CS6000

​                0.5 parts    Activator A900X*

​     Initial Spraying     19 - 50 seconds Zahn Cup # 2, Signature series

​     Viscosity         27 - 80 seconds ISO Cup #4

​     (25°C/77°F)

​     Pot L ife      2.5- 3 hours (with Standard Activator A9002), depending on color.
​     (25°C/77°F)    For alternative activators A9003 and A9004, see page 4.

​     Dry Film     25 - 75 micron (μm) depending on the color being applied,
​     Thickness     1.0- 3.0 mils
​     (DFT)

​   Application Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:   35- 95%

Aerodur 3002 （Clear Coat）

​   Characteristics       - Aerodur 3002 is a chemically cured, long life clear coat for use in aapplication
​       Product         - base coat / clear coat system formulated to provide uniform appearance in
​       Information         one box coat application.
                    - This clear coat formulation, in combination with the specified
              Aerodur 3001 Base Coat, provides cycle time reduction, superior
              chemical and stain resistance, flexibility, and weathering performance.
                    - When used with AkzoNobel primers; 37098 (AIMS 04.04.013), 37124
              (AIMS04.04.031),10P20-44 (BMS 10-79,TY II & I) 10P20-44M or
              10P20- 44MNF (BMS 10-72 Type lX), or 10P20-12 (DMS 2104) and the
              specified polyurethane Aerodur 3001 Base Coat Solid Colors and Special
              Effects, this system provides a durable long lasting, protective and
              decorative finish that exceeds typical OEM requirements for exterior
              aircraft performance.

​   Components
​       Base              3002G00002
​       Curing Solution     CS6003
​      Activator        A905X*

​   Instruction for Use

​       Mixing Ratio     2 parts     Base   3002G00002
​       (volume)        2 parts     Curing Solution   CS6003

​                  1 parts     Activator  A905X*

​       Initial Spraying     15- 20 seconds Zahn-Cup # 2, signature series

​       Viscosity         28 - 38 seconds ISO-Cup #4

​       (25°C/77°F)

​       Pot L ife         2 hours with Standard Activator A9052 (LMT Surf). 4 hours with Standard
​       (25°C/77°F)         Activator A9055. For pot life of alternative activators A9050 and A9053, seepage 5.

​       Dry Film     25 - 37.5 micron (μm)
​       Thickness     1.0- 1.5mils
​       (DFT)

​   Application Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:   40- 75%

高固态

10P20-44 （High Solids Epoxy Primer）

​   Characteristics       - A high solids urethane compatible, SkydrolI resistant primer for the exterior
​       Product          of aircraft. It provides excellent corrosion resistance and excellent
​       Information         adhesion for urethane topcoats.

​   Components
​       Curing Solution,              Curing solution: EC -265, EC-273
​       Thinner/Reducer          Thinner: TR-114, TR-102，

​   Instruction for Use

​       Mixing Ratio     3 parts     Base   10P20-44
​       (volume)        1 parts     Curing Solution   EC -265 or EC-273

​                  1 parts     Thinner  TR-114 or TR-102

​       Initial Spraying     23-30secondsISOCup#4 3:1 mix ratio

​       Viscosity         16 - 23 seconds Signature Zahn Cup # 2 3:1 mix ratio

​       (25°C/77°F)

​       Pot L ife         1 hour.       No thinner
​       (25°C/77°F)         4 hours.      With 1 part TR-114 or TR-102 (recommended)

​       Dry Film     15 - 23 micron (μm)
​       Thickness     0.6- 0.9mils
​       (DFT)

​   Application
​   Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:   35- 75%

10P2-3 （Anti-static Conductive Flat Black Epoxy Coating）

​   Characteristics       - This epoxy coating is designed to produce an anti-static conductive film on
​       Product          fiberglass components. It can be air cured or force dried.
​       Information      

​   Components
​       Curing Solution,              Curing Solution: EC-110

​   Instruction for Use

​       Mixing Ratio     3 parts     Base   10P2-3
​       (volume)        1 parts     Curing Solution: EC-110

​       Initial Spraying     25 - 35 seconds ISO-Cup 4.

​       Viscosity         16 - 20 seconds Signature Zahn-Cup #2

​       (25°C/77°F)     15土3 seconds Ford Cup #4

​       Pot L ife         4 hour min- 8 hour max.
​       (25°C/77°F)    

​       Dry Film     15 - 25 micron (μm)
​       Thickness     0.6- 1.0mils
​       (DFT)

​   Application Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:   35- 75%

23T3 Series （VOC Compliant Abrasion Resistant Polyurethane Coating）

​   Characteristics       - Two component PTFE-filled, polyurethane anti-chafe
​       Product          air curing coating. .
​       Information       - Inherently light stable with excellent abrasion resistance and surface
                       lubricity.
                    - For use on aircraft control surfaces.
             - Resistant to hydraulic fluids (Skydrol , Aerosafe, HyJet), aircraft fuel,

​   Components
​       Curing Solution     Curing solution PC-216
​      Thinner/Reducer    Thinner: 66C28, 66C20, TR-19, TR-20 or TR-115 where VOC regulations allow.

​   Instruction for Use

​       Mixing Ratio     3 parts     Base 23T3-XXX
​       (volume)        1 parts     Curing Solution PC-216

​       Initial Spraying     16- 24 seconds ISO Cup #6

​       Viscosity         15- 27 seconds Signature Zahn Cup #3

​       (25°C/77°F)

​       Pot L ife         After 1 hour: 72 seconds ISo Cup #6
​       (25°C/77°F)         After 2 hours: Sprayable.

​       Dry Film     125 - 250 micron (μm)
​       Thickness     5- 10mils
​       (DFT)

​   Application Recommendations
​  

​       Conditions       15 - 35°C/59 - 95°F

​       Relative Humidity:   35- 75%

PPG

BCCC

CA7700 “B”

  Product Description

  Desoprime™ CA7700 series epoxy primers are designed for use on aircraft exterior
  and/or exterior detail parts (components). This primer is designed for use with non-
  electrostatic spray equipment.

  NOTE:However, for improved efficiency with electrostatic spray equipment the suggested
  activator is CA7700BE instead of CA7 700B.

    Urethane topcoat compatible

    Passes the rain erosion test

    Excellent adhesion and corrosion resistance

    Compatible with all non-electrostatic spray equipment

    Excellent fluid resistance

    Can be applied in a wide range of conditions

    Service temperature -54°C to 177°C (-65°F to 350°F)

  Components
   Mix ratio (by volume):

​         CA7 700A (base component)    1 part
​        CA7 700B (activator component)  1 part

​ Induction I Time:

​

 Temperture 13-17℃
  (55-64℉) 		 18-23℃
 (65-74℉) 		 24-28℃
 (75-84℉) 		 >29℃
 (>85℉) 
Induction I Time 1 ½ hours   1hour  30 minutes   None 

​ Application Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 30°C/59 - 86°F

​       Relative Humidity:   20- 90%

​       Pot L ife     6 hours.
​       (21-25°C/70-77°F)

Note: In areas where exempt solvents are allowed, to improve the spray characteristics
and wet edge in hot humid environments, CA1800CX or CA1805CX may be added.
This will not increase the VOC where exempt solvents are permissible. The suggested
level of thinner is up to 1 quart or 12.5% by volume. Do not use thinners or flow control
agents from other manufacturers. These often contain material that will degrade the
cure, adhesion, or appearance of the primer.

CA7700 “BE”

  Product Description

  Desoprime™ CA7700 series epoxy primers are designed for use on aircraft exterior
  and/or exterior detail parts (components). The “BE “Activator is used with electrostatic
  spray equipment for improved application characteristics

   Compatible with urethane topcoats

    Passes the rain erosion test

    Excellent adhesion and corrosion resistance

    Compatible with all current spray equipmen

    Excellent fluid resistance

    Can be applied in a wide range of conditions

    Service temperature -54°C to 177°C (-65°F to 350°F)

  Components
   Mix ratio (by volume):

​         CA7 700A (base component)    1 part
​        CA7 700BE (activator component)  1 part

​ Induction I Time:

​

 Temperture 13-17℃
  (55-64℉) 		 18-23℃
 (65-74℉) 		 24-28℃
 (75-84℉) 		 >29℃
 (>85℉) 
Induction I Time 1 ½ hours   1hour  30 minutes   None 

​ Application Recommendations

​       Conditions       15 - 30°C/59 - 86°F

​       Relative Humidity:   20- 90%

​       Pot L ife     3 hours.
​       (21-25°C/70-77°F)

Note: In areas where exempt solvents are allowed, to improve the spray characteristics
and wet edge in hot humid environments, CA1800CX or CA1805CX may be added.
This will not increase the VOC where exempt solvents are permissible. The suggested
level of thinner is up to 1 quart or 12.5% by volume. Do not use thinners or flow control
agents from other manufacturers. These often contain material that will degrade the
cure, adhesion, or appearance of the primer.

高固态

515K011

  Product Description

   Super Koropon® 515K011 fluid resistant interior primer is a conventional solids, lead
   and cadmium free epoxy coating. 515K011 high performance primer is formulated to
   protect the interior of aircraft from corrosion.
    Easy to spray

    Compatible with epoxy and urethane interior topcoats

    Excellent adhesion to all aluminum and composite surfaces

    Excellent Skydrol® resistance

    Compatible with all current non-electrostatic spray equipment

    Can be applied in a wide range of conditions

topcoats to improve spray characteristics and film appearance. CA1805CX can used in
hot weather conditions (above 29°C/85°F) to increase the wet edge of the coating.

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号53-15-11
entry.content:
** ON A/C FSN ALL

TASK 53-15-11-300-001-A

Repair of the Radome

WARNING:

PUT THE SAFETY DEVICES AND THE WARNING NOTICES IN POSITION BEFORE YOU START A TASK ON OR NEAR:

-

THE FLIGHT CONTROLS

-

THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES

-

THE LANDING GEAR AND THE RELATED DOORS

-

COMPONENTS THAT MOVE.

MOVEMENT OF COMPONENTS CAN KILL OR CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT.

WARNING:

BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE CONSUMABLE MATERIALS. OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER’S INSTRUCTIONS AND YOUR LOCAL REGULATIONS.

Reason for the Job

Self explanatory

Job Set-up Information

A.

Fixtures, Tools, Test and Support Equipment

REFERENCEQTYDESIGNATION
No specific1ABRASIVE - 280-320 GRIT SILICON CARBIDE SANDPAPER
No specific1ABRASIVE PAPER - 80 GRIT
No specific1ABRASIVE PAPER -120 GRIT
No specific1ACCESS PLATFORM 5M (16 FT)- ADJUSTABLE

B.

Consumable Materials

REFERENCEDESIGNATION
05EML7Epoxy Adhesive– - Legacy 3
05RQB1Adhesive Film Tape-Erosion Protective Polyurethane - 0.36mm -
05RSB1Adhesive Film Tape-Radome Erosion Protective Polyurethane -
08BAA9Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - -
14SBA1Textile-Lint free Cotton -

C.

Work Zones and Access Panels

ZONE/ACCESSZONE DESCRIPTION
110RADOME (NOSE CONE TO FR 1)

D.

Referenced Information

REFERENCEDESIGNATION
Ref. 53-15-11-000-001-ARemoval of the Radome
** ON A/C FSN POST SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352
Ref. 53-15-11-000-007-ARemoval of the Boot from the Radome
** ON A/C FSN ALL
Ref. 53-15-11-400-001-AInstallation of the Radome
Ref. 53-15-11-400-001-A01Installation of the Radome
** ON A/C FSN POST SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352
Ref. 53-15-11-400-007-AInstallation of the Boot on the Radome
** ON A/C FSN ALL
Ref. CMM 53-15-11 (F6198)
Ref. CMM 53-15-12 (F6198)
Ref. Fig. Temporary Repair of the Radome
Ref. Fig. Permanent Repair of the Radome

Job Set-up

** ON A/C FSN ALL

PRE SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352

SUBTASK 53-15-11-941-061-A

A.

Get Access

(1)

Put the ACCESS PLATFORM 5M (16 FT)- ADJUSTABLE in position at zone 110.

** ON A/C FSN

POST SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352

SUBTASK 53-15-11-941-061-B

A.

Get Access

(1)

Put the ACCESS PLATFORM 5M (16 FT)- ADJUSTABLE in position at zone 110.

(2)

Remove the boot from the radome Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-000-007.

** ON A/C FSN ALL

Procedure

SUBTASK 53-15-11-350-050-A

A.

Temporary Repair of the Radome

Ref. Fig. Temporary Repair of the Radome

CAUTION:

DO NOT PUT POLYURETHANE TAPE OR SELF-ADHESIVE PATCHES ON MORE THAN 490 cm2 (75.95 in.2) OF THE RADOME SURFACE.

BEFORE YOU DO A TEMPORARY REPAIR, MAKE SURE THAT THE RADOME DOES NOT HAVE POLYURETHANE TAPE OR SELF-ADHESIVE PATCHES ON MORE THAN 490 cm2 (75.95 in.2) OF ITS SURFACE.

IF THERE IS ALREADY A TEMPORARY REPAIR SOLUTION ON MORE THAN 490 cm2 (75.95 in.2) OF THE RADOME SURFACE:

-

DO A PERMANENT REPAIR OR

-

IMMEDIATELY REMOVE AND REPLACE THE RADOME.

CAUTION:

A MAXIMUM OF ONE 250 mm (9.8425 in.) DIAMETER DAMAGE AREA AND FIVE 50 mm (1.9685 in.) DIAMETER DAMAGE AREAS ARE PERMITTED ON THE RADOME SHELL. IF THERE ARE ALREADY ONE 250 mm (9.8425 in.) DIAMETER DAMAGE AREA AND FIVE 50 mm (1.9685 in.) DIAMETER DAMAGE AREAS, DO NOT DO A TEMPORARY REPAIR BUT REMOVE AND REPLACE THE RADOME.

THIS CAUTION IS NOT APPLICABLE TO PAINT PEELING DAMAGE.

CAUTION:

DO NOT USE POLYURETHANE TAPE AND SELF-ADHESIVE PATCHES ON THE LIGHTNING STUDS. THEY HAVE AN EFFECT ON THE LIGHTNING PROTECTION OF THE RADOME.

(1)

The repair procedure with Adhesive Film Tape-Erosion Protective Polyurethane - 0.36mm - (Material Ref. 05RQB1) or Adhesive Film Tape-Radome Erosion Protective Polyurethane - (Material Ref. 05RSB1) (do not use 5015GS or materials from the ADHETEC supplier) is applicable to the radomes that follow:

-

The KEVLAR radome (P/Ns D5311047700001, D5311047700002, D5311047700003, D5311047700004 and D5311047700005)

-

The QUARTZ radome (P/Ns D5311047700006, D5311047700007 and D53132010000)

-

The S2 GLASS radome (P/Ns D53132110000 and D53132210000).

(a)

Remove the grease from the damaged area with the Textile-Lint free Cotton - (Material Ref. 14SBA1) made moist with Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - - (Material Ref. 08BAA9).

(b)

Apply Adhesive Film Tape-Erosion Protective Polyurethane - 0.36mm - (Material Ref. 05RQB1) or Adhesive Film Tape-Radome Erosion Protective Polyurethane - (Material Ref. 05RSB1) (do not use 5015BC, 5015GS or materials from the ADHETEC supplier) on the damaged area.

(c)

Permanently repair the gouges, nicks, scratches and debonding of the aircraft skin in the next 600 Flight Hours (FH).

(2)

The repair procedure with a white or gray self-adhesive patch with a diameter of 50 mm (1.9685 in.) (you can use 5015BC, 5015GS or materials from the ADHETEC supplier) is applicable to the radomes that follow:

-

The QUARTZ radome (P/Ns D5311047700006, D5311047700007 and D53132010000)

-

The S2 GLASS radome (P/Ns D53132110000 and D53132210000).

(a)

Remove the grease from the damaged area with the Textile-Lint free Cotton - (Material Ref. 14SBA1) made moist with Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - - (Material Ref. 08BAA9).

(b)

Apply a white or gray self-adhesive patch with a diameter of 50 mm (1.9685 in.) (you can use 5015BC, 5015GS or materials from the ADHETEC supplier) on the damaged area.

NOTE:

The maximum number of patches is 25 for each radome.

The minimum distance between each patch is 100 mm (3.9370 in.).

(3)

The repair procedure with aluminum tape with a diameter of 25 mm (0.9843 in.) is applicable to the S2 GLASS radome only (P/Ns D53132110000 and D53132210000):

(a)

Remove the grease from the damaged area with the Textile-Lint free Cotton - (Material Ref. 14SBA1) made moist with Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - - (Material Ref. 08BAA9).

(b)

Apply aluminum tape with a diameter of 25 mm (0.9843 in.) on the damaged area of the lightning stud.

(c)

Make sure that the aluminum tape is used on the lightning studs only.

SUBTASK 53-15-11-350-052-A

B.

Permanent Repair of the Radome

Ref. Fig. Permanent Repair of the Radome

(1)

If there are burn marks on the heads of the screws of the lightning arrester strips, do the steps that follow before 600 FH or during the next check:

(a)

Remove the radome

Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-000-001

.

(b)

Send the radome to the workshop for repair or replacement of the screws of the lightning arrester strips.

(c)

Install a serviceable radome

Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-400-001

.

(2)

If there are burn marks on the lightning arrester strips, do the steps that follow before 600 FH or during the next check:

(a)

Remove the radome

Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-000-001

.

(b)

Send the radome to the workshop for repair or replacement of the lightning arrester strips.

(c)

Install a serviceable radome

Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-400-001

.

CAUTION:

MAKE SURE THAT THE DISTANCE (X) BETWEEN TWO RESIN INJECTIONS IS MORE THAN THE WIDTH OF THE LARGER RESIN INJECTION: X > MAX. DIA.

IF THE DISTANCE IS LESS, DO NOT DO A SECOND RESIN INJECTION BUT A PRE-PREG REPAIR THAT INCLUDES THE FIRST INJECTION.

IF THE NUMBER OF EXISTING INJECTIONS IS THE MAXIMUM PERMITTED, THE NEW INJECTION (DIA. < 50 MM) MUST INCLUDE THE PREVIOUS INJECTION IF POSSIBLE. IF IT CANNOT, YOU MUST DO A PRE-PREG REPAIR.

(3)

The repair procedure with the resin injection is applicable to the radomes that follow:

-

The KEVLAR radome (P/Ns D5311047700001, D5311047700002, D5311047700003, D5311047700004 and D5311047700005)

-

The QUARTZ radome (P/Ns D5311047700006, D5311047700007 and D53132010000)

-

The S2 GLASS radome (P/Ns D53132110000 and D53132210000).

This permanent repair is only applicable to damage with a diameter less than or equal to 50 mm (1.9685 in.).

NOTE:

The maximum number of resin injections is five for each radome.

(a)

Make sure that the damaged area is dry.

(b)

Rub a surface of 20 mm (0.7874 in.) to 30 mm (1.1811 in.) larger than the damaged area with ABRASIVE PAPER - 80 GRIT until you get to the anti-static paint.

(c)

Then rub this area with the

ABRASIVE PAPER -120 GRIT

and the

ABRASIVE - 280-320 GRIT SILICON CARBIDE SANDPAPER until the paint is completely removed.

(d)

Make sure that the composite structure is not damaged.

(e)

Remove the grease from the damaged area with a clean

Textile-Lint free Cotton - (Material Ref.

14SBA1

)

made moist with the

Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - - (Material Ref.

08BAA9

).

(f)

Drill a 3 mm (0.1181 in.) hole at a pitch diameter of 7 mm (0.2756 in.) in the outer skin. Do this until you go to the honeycomb cells of all the damaged area.

(g)

Drill the skin thickness approximately 1 mm (0.0394 in.).

(h)

Remove the swarf.

(i)

Carefully clean the drilled holes with the

Non Aqueous Cleaner-General - - (Material Ref.

08BAA9

).

(j)

Fill the syringe with the

Epoxy Adhesive– - Legacy 3 (Material Ref.

05EML7

) and fill the holes in the honeycomb until the resin overflows.

(k)

Remove the unwanted resin.

NOTE:

The cure time for the Epoxy Adhesive– - Legacy 3 (Material Ref. 05EML7) is 24 hours at ambient temperature or one hour at a maximum of 60 DEG.C (140 DEG.F).

(l)

Do a paint touch-up:

1

For all types of radome (not applicable to the S2 GLASS radome) Ref. CMM 53-15-11 (F6198)

2

For the S2 GLASS radome only Ref. CMM 53-15-12 (F6198).

Close-up

** ON A/C FSN ALL

PRE SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352

SUBTASK 53-15-11-860-051-A

A.

Close Access

(1)

Make sure that the work area is clean and clear of tools and other items.

(2)

Remove the access platform(s).

(3)

Remove the ground support and maintenance equipment, the special and standard tools and all other items.

** ON A/C FSN

POST SB 53-1442 for A/C 023-023, 101-102, 202-202, 301-302, 351-352

SUBTASK 53-15-11-860-051-B

A.

Close Access

(1)

Make sure that the work area is clean and clear of tools and other items.

(2)

If you did a permanent repair of the radome, install the boot on the radome Ref. AMM TASK 53-15-11-400-007.

(3)

Remove the access platform(s).

(4)

Remove the ground support and maintenance equipment, the special and standard tools and all other items.

entry.title: 51-23-11 油漆涂料
entry.content:
51-23-11 - Description - Paint Coatings

51-23-11 -描述-油漆涂料

CAUTION: DO NOT USE METAL TOOLS TO REMOVE THE UNWANTED MATERIAL. METAL TOOLS CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SURFACE OF THE COMPONENT.

1.General

A.This section gives you information about the paint scheme of the aircraft. Refer to supplier information for application and properties of each paint coating. For special coatings refer to Chapter 51-23-12.

B.Each product, which is given in the paint scheme tables by the material numbers in Paragraph 2..A., can be determined in CML.

C.If you have to repair the original surface protection, for example after corrosion removal or structural repair, refer to Chapter 51-75-12.

2.Procedure

A.Paint Scheme

(1)The subsequent parts are not painted:

-

leading edge of slats (bonding primer only) and leading edge of engine inlet cowl,

-

external surface of the pylon made of corrosion resistant materials (stainless steel/titanium),

-

passenger and bulk cargo door scuff plates,

-

APU exhaust,

-

equipment components, for example angle of attack sensors and static ports,

-

removed or internal side of cabin pressurization Control System Outflow Valve (Zone 172),

-

refer to Chapter 51-75-12 for repainting of the external face of the avionics skin temperature sensor (28HQ) support,

-

ball lock fittings.

(2)Fuselage

(a)Internal Areas - General (Refer to Table 1)

AREAPARTSPRETREATMENTPAINT COATINGS
ASkin panels, stringers of lap joint assemblies, butt strapsCAA unsealedMaterial No. 04DAB2
Stringers, frames and cleatsCAA unsealed or Material No. 10ABC1 for clad parts
BSkin panels, stringers of lap joints assemblies, butt straps, frames and cleatsCAA unsealedMaterial No. 04DAB2 + Material No. 04JME4
StringersCAA unsealed or Material No. 10ABC1 for clad parts
CSkin panels, all stringers, frames and cleats, butt strapsCAA unsealedMaterial No. 04DAB2 + Material No. 04JME4

Table 1 - Internal Paint Scheme - Fuselage

Area A:

-

the upper area is increased from STGR18LH thru STGR23LH and STGR18RH thru STGR23RH.

Area B:

-

STGR23LH thru STGR32LH, and STGR23RH thru STGR32RH.

Area C:

-

FR1 thru FR64, lower area STGR32LH thru STGR32RH. All internal areas aft of FR64.

NOTE:

In FR64 thru FR70 (Refer to Chapter 51-00-00) AFT of FR64, top coat polyurethane (Material No. 04JAA3) may be used instead of top coat polyurethane (Material No. 04JME4).

NOTE:

The abbreviation ‘CAA’ is used for Chromic Acid Anodizing.

External Areas

External Areas

AREAPRETREATMENTPAINT COATINGS

H2NONEMaterial No. 13FCA1 + Material No. 04EAC2 + Material No. 04JAA3
H3CAA UNSEALEDMaterial No. 04DAB2 + Material No. 04JAA3

For the determination of the different areas refer to Figure 005. The abbreviation ‘CAA’ is used for Chromic Acid Anodizing.

NOTE:

The use of antistatic paint is not necessary on to Carbonfiber Reinforced Plastic (CFRP) components.

B.

Paint Coatings

(1)

Pretreatment

For information about chromic acid anodizing, wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2), surface pretreatment (Material No. 10ABC1) and epoxy primer (Material No. 16-006B or Material No. 16-006C), refer to Chapter 51-21-11.

(2)

Primer

(a)

General

1

The primer is composed of a polyurethane or epoxy basis, an activator (catalyst) or hardener and, if required, a thinner. The different primers which are used for the aircraft protection can be divided into two main groups:

-

primer with chromate.

-

primer without chromate.

(3)

Top Coat and Finish Paint

(a)

General

1

Top coat and finish paint are composed of a polyurethane basis, a hardener and, if required, a thinner. The two coatings used for the aircraft protection are:

-

top coat polyurethane (Material No. 04JME4) for internal areas.

-

top coat polyurethane (Material No. 04JAA3) for external areas.

Figure 001 / 51-23-11 (sheet 1) External and Internal Paint Scheme - Fuselage

Figure 001 / 51-23-11 (sheet 2) External Paint Scheme - After Modification 20023P0010

Figure 002 / 51-23-11 (sheet 1) External Paint Scheme - Wing Top Skin

Figure 003 / 51-23-11 (sheet 1) External Paint Scheme - Wing Bottom Skin

Figure 004 / 51-23-11 (sheet 1) Paint Scheme - Stabilizer After Modification 21355K1346

Figure 005 / 51-23-11 (sheet 1) External Paint Scheme - Pylon and Nacelle CFM56

Figure 005 / 51-23-11 (sheet 2) External Paint Scheme - Pylon and Nacelle V2500

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号51-75-12
entry.content:
51-75-12 - Description - REPAIR OF PAINT COATINGS

51-755-12 .描述。油漆涂层的修补

1.注意事项：

警告

WARNING:THIS PART IS NO LONGER APPLICABLE
警告: 本部分不再适用

CAUTION: DO NOT USE METAL TOOLS TO REMOVE THE UNWANTED MATERIAL. METAL TOOLS CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SURFACE OF THE COMPONENT.
注意: 不要使用金属工具去除不需要的材料。金属工具会对零件表面造成损伤。

CAUTION: AVOID CUTTING PROTECTIVE FILMS, TAPES, MASKS OR MARKINGS ON THE AIRCRAFT SKIN TO PREVENT SCRIBE MARKS. IF THIS OPERATION IS REQUIRED, USE SCISSORS OR A PLATE BETWEEN THE FILM (MINIMUM 0.6 MM (0.024 IN) THICKNESS WITH METAL AND 2 MM (0.079 IN) THICKNESS WITH HARD PLASTIC) AND THE AIRCRAFT SKIN OR USE A SPECIAL CUTTER (REFERENCE MARTOR−POLY PICK NO. 469 FROM 3M), THEN INSPECT.
注意:避免在飞机表面切割保护膜、胶带、口罩或标记，防止划痕。如果需要进行此操作，请使用剪刀或纸板将薄膜(金属薄膜厚度最小为0.6 mm，硬塑料薄膜厚度最小为2mm)与飞机外壳隔开，或使用专用刀具(参考martor - poly pick no . 1)。469从3m)，然后检查。

CAUTION: IF PAINTING OF THE ESCAPE SLIDE RAFTS IS NECESSARY, MAKE SURE THAT THE SURROUNDING AREA AND THE COMPONENTS OF THE RAFTS ARE PROPERLY PROTECTED AGAINST PAINT MATERIALS. IF THE BLOWOUT PANEL OF THE ESCAPE SLIDE RAFT MUST BE REPAINTED, MAKE SURE TO PUT MASKING MATERIAL ON THE HOLES AND THE BALL LOCK FITTINGS (REFER TO FIGURE 11). FOR INFORMATION AND LOCATION OF THE ESCAPE SLIDE RAFTS, REFER TO AMM CHAPTER 25-62-00. FOR INFORMATION ABOUT THE BLOWOUT PANEL, REFER TO AMM CHAPTER 25-62-42.
注意:如果需要对逃生滑梯进行涂刷，请确保周围区域和滑梯的组件受到适当的保护，不受油漆材料的影响。如果逃生滑筏的防喷板必须重新喷漆，请确保在孔和球锁接头上涂上遮蔽材料(参见图11)。有关逃生滑梯的信息和位置，请参阅amm第25-62-00章。有关防爆面板的信息，请参见amm第25-62-42章。

1.General

注意事项

NOTE: This task is inactive since revision dated Aug 01/16 and is superseded by Tasks TASK 51-75-12-911-001 thru TASK 51-75-12-911-017.
提示:自2016年8月1日修订日期以来，该任务处于非活动状态，并由任务task51 -75-12-911-001至task 51-75-12-911-017取代。

NOTE: It is recommended for wet/wet application to use all materials from one supplier for compatibility reasons.

提示:出于兼容性原因，建议湿/湿应用使用来自一个供应商的所有材料。

A.The following paint repairs are described in Paragraph 11. thru 10. :
以下油漆修理情况见第11至10段:

-Repair of damaged top coat for metal, composite and glare parts
修复损坏的金属、复合材料和眩光部件的面漆

-Renewal of paint build-up after damage to metal and glare parts
-在金属和眩光部件损坏后更新油漆

-Renewal of paint build-up of composite components that require no anti-erosion paint
-更新不需要抗侵蚀涂料的复合部件的油漆

-Renewal of paint build-up of composite components that require anti-erosion paint
-更新需要抗侵蚀涂料的复合部件的油漆

-Repair of peeled-off paint coatings on fastener heads
-修复紧固件头上脱落的油漆涂层

-Application of anti-erosion tape on vertical and horizontal stabilizer leading edge
- 垂直水平稳定器前缘防腐胶带的应用

-Renewal of damaged fuel tank top coating on center tank and horizontal stabilizer tank
-更换损坏的中央油箱和水平稳定舱顶部涂层

-Renewal of external paint build-up with AMS 3095 external paint scheme
-使用AMS 3095外部涂料方案更新外部涂料

-Renewal of external paint coating of navigation and communication antennas
-更新导航和通信天线外部涂料

-Application of ANTI-EROSION tape on VHF, ATC/DME antennas
-抗腐蚀胶带在VHF、ATC/DME天线上的应用

-Renewal of external paint build-up on AOA probe plate
-更新AOA探测板上的外部油漆

-Renewal of airline finish on radome
- 更新雷达罩上的油漆

-Renewal of external paint build-up on fuselage with intermediate coat paint scheme
- 用中间涂层方案更新机身外部涂层

-Renewal of external paint build-up on customized areas with base coat/clear coat paint scheme
- 更新个别地区的面漆，并使用底漆/清漆涂料方案

-Renewal of external paint build-up with chromate free paint scheme
-使用无铬酸盐涂料方案更新外部面漆

B.Paint thickness requirements

B .油漆厚度要求

(1) Except for radome, antennas and areas covered with anti erosion coating, the maximum recommended paint thickness is 350 microns (13780 microinches) and 400 microns (15748 microinches) for nacelles. If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded, this can cause electrical discharge which can interfere with the communication and navigation systems.
(1)除雷达罩、天线和覆盖防侵蚀涂层的区域外，建议最大涂层厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)，机舱最大涂层厚度为400微米(15748微英寸)。如果超过推荐的涂料厚度，这可能会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

(2) Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted area should not exceed 400 microns (15748 microinches).

(2)在静压孔和皮托管探头(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的间距不应超过400微米(15748微英寸)。

(3) Radome airline finish paint thickness requirements

(3)雷达罩涂层厚度要求：

(a) For repainting you can omit the primer below the top coat or base coat/clear coat.

(a)在重新油漆时，可省略面漆或底漆/清漆下面的底漆。

(b) Old airline finish paint must be completely removed.

(b)旧飞机面漆必须完全去除。

(c) The thickness given below is airline finish defined as top coat, base coat+clear coat or top coat/base coat+mica top coat/base coat+clear coat.
(c)下列厚度为面漆，定义为面漆、底漆 + 清漆或面漆/底漆 + 云母面漆/底漆 + 清漆。

Figure 001 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) General paint scheme with top coat

Figure 002 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) General paint scheme with base coat and clear coat

Figure 003 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Specific paint scheme for MICA paints

CAUTION: DO NOT USE PAINTS WHICH CONTAIN METALLIC PIGMENTS.

注意: 不要使用含有金属颜料的涂料。

(d) Measure the thickness on lightning strips before and after application of airline finish paint using positector 6000 series (DEFELSKO) and 0 ° NOS microprobes (or equivalent) or paint borer reference 518S from Erichsen on composite flat areas.
(d)在复合材料区域上，使用6000系列(DEFELSKO)和0°NOS微探头(或同等产品)或Erichsen的参考518S油漆钻孔机，测量航空面漆涂装前后雷击带的厚度。

NOTE: Make sure that you do not damage the substrate.
提示:请确保不要损坏基材。

NOTE: Do not overlap different colors.

提示:不同颜色不要重叠。

PAINT TYPE
油漆类型		COLOR
颜色		SA RADOME BASIC: PN D53110477
雷达罩		SA RADOME POST MOD 32638 PN D53132010SE RADOME PN D53132110000
MAXIMUM THICKNESS IN MICRONS (MICROINCHES)
最大厚度（微米）		MAXIMUM THICKNESS IN MICRONS (MICROINCHES)
最大厚度（微米）		MAX THICKNESS IN MICRONS (MICROINCHES)
最大厚度（微米）
Top coat
面漆		White
白色		190 (7480)220 (8661)290 (11417)
Top coat
面漆		Grey / Black
灰色 |黑色		180 (7086)210 (6268)290 (11417)
Top coat
面漆		Other colors
其他颜色		400 (15748)400 (15748)400 (15748)
Mica paint
云母颜料		White
白色		330 (12992) <1>370 (14566) <1>390 (15354) <1>
Mica paint
云母颜料		Grey / Black
灰色和黑色		330 (12992) <1>370 (14566) <1>390 (15354) <1>
Mica paint
云母颜料		Other colors
其他颜色		390 (15344) <1>390 (15344) <1>390 (15354) <1>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		White mankiewicz
白色mankiewicz		220 (8661) <2>220 (8661) <2>210 (8267) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		White from other manufacturer’s
White from other manufacturer’s
其他厂家生产的白色		260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Grey / Black
灰色加黑色		260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Other colors
其他按颜色		260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>260 (10236) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Mika white from mankiewicz
乳白色mankiewicz		270 (10629) <2>310 (12205) <2>310 (12204) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Mica white from other manufacturer’s
其他厂家生产的云母白		310 (12205) <2>370 (14566) <2>390 (15354) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Mica grey / black
云母灰色和黑色		330 (12992) <2>390 (15344) <2>390 (15354) <2>
Base coat+clear coat
底漆 + 清漆		Other colors
其他颜色		370 (14566) <2>390 (15344) <2>390 (15354) <2>

Table 1

<1>We assume 3 layers of equal thickness.
<1>我们假设3层厚度相等。

<2>Clear coat thickness is 110 microns (4331 microinches) maximum.
< 2 > 透明涂层厚度最大为110微米(4331微英寸)。

C. Other requirements

C. 其他要求

(1) Except the airline finish coating, restore the other coating layers applied on radome in accordance with CMM Chapter 53–15–11.
(1)除航空涂层外，按照 CMM 第53-15-11章的规定恢复雷达罩上涂敷的其他涂层。

(2) Paint repair on elevator greater than 150000 mm² (232.5 in.²) remove the elevator and paint in accordance with CMM Chapter 55–21–15.
(2)对大于150000平方毫米(232.5英寸)的升降舵进行油漆修复。根据 CMM 章节55-21-15拆除升降舵进行粉刷。

(3) AOA plates shall not be painted on the aircraft (Refer to paragraph 13.).
(3)不得在飞机上喷涂 AOA 牌照(见第13段)。

NOTE: Local brush touch up painting can be performed on the aircraft providing the probe is masked with paper film. Remove masking and inspect the probe after painting (Refer to AMM Chapter 34–11–19–200–001–A).

提示:如果探头被纸膜覆盖，则可以在飞机上进行局部刷补漆。油漆后拆下遮蔽物，检查探头(参考AMM章34-11-19-200-001-A)。

(4) Masking of AOA prior to painting.

(4)涂装前 AOA 的遮蔽。

(a) Apply flexible vinyl tape at the edge of AOA plate, refer to Figure 004.

(a)在 AOA 板的边缘应用弹性乙烯基胶带，请参阅图004。

Figure 004 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Flexible tape (yellow) on edge of AOA plate

(b) Install masking tape and paper as shown in Figure 005.

(b)如图005所示安装遮蔽胶带及纸张。

Figure 005 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Masking of AOA sensor

(5) If the standard certified color BAC 707 or a color with a solar absorptivity coefficient equal or lower than 0.65 is not to be used to restore paint or repainting of the upper surfaces of:
(5)如标准认证的颜色 BAC707或太阳吸收系数等于或低于0.65的颜色，不得用于恢复以下表面的油漆或重新油漆:

-Horizontal tailplane
-水平尾翼

-Elevator
-升降舵

-Ailerons
-副翼

-Spoilers and flaps,
-扰流板和襟翼

please contact AIRBUS for the approval of the nonstandard paint color.
请与空中客车公司联系，以获得非标准油漆颜色的认可

2.Safety Precautions

2.安全预防措施

NOTE: When you do repainting near AOA sensors, we recommend that you mask the sensors.
提示: 当您在 AOA 传感器附近重新喷漆时，我们建议您遮蔽传感器。

WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE CONSUMABLE MATERIALS. OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER’S INSTRUCTIONS AND YOUR LOCAL REGULATIONS.
警告: 使用消耗材料时要小心。遵守材料制造商的指示和当地的规章制度。

WARNING: OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS WHEN YOU USE PAINTS, CHROMATE AGENTS, CLEANING AGENTS AND SPECIAL COATINGS. MOST OF THESE MATERIALS ARE DANGEROUS AND FLAMMABLE.
警告: 使用油漆、铬酸盐剂、清洁剂和特殊涂料时，请遵守材料制造商的指示。这些材料大部分都是危险易燃的。

WARNING: DO NOT APPLY ADHESIVE TAPE ON THE PROBES, DUCTS AND SENSORS (STATIC PITOT, TAT, AOA). USE ONLY THE SPECIFIED TOOLS FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE AIRCRAFT.
警告: 不要在探头、导管和传感器上使用胶带(静态皮托管、 TAT、 AOA)。只使用指定的工具保护飞机。

THE SPECIFIED TOOLS GIVE THE CORRECT PROTECTION TO THE AIRCRAFT EQUIPMENT. THE SPECIFIED TOOLS ARE EASY TO SEE FROM THE GROUND. THE SPECIFIED TOOLS ARE EASY TO REMOVE.
指定的工具对飞机设备提供正确的保护。指定的工具在地面上很容易看到。指定的工具很容易移除。

IF YOU USE TAPE, THERE IS A RISK THAT SOME TAPE, OR ADHESIVE FROM THE TAPE, WILL STAY ON THE PROBES, DUCTS OR SENSORS. THIS CAN CAUSE INCORRECT INDICATIONS ON THE RELATED COCKPIT INSTRUMENTS.
如果你使用胶带，有些胶带，或者胶带上的粘合剂，会留在探头，管道或者传感器上。这会导致相关驾驶舱仪表指示错误。

WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AOA HEATER OR MFP CIRCUIT BREAKERS ARE PULLED DURING STRIPPING, PAINTING AND HANDLING OF AOA. LET THE AOA/MFP COOL DOWN A FEW MINUTES BEFORE MASKING OR HANDLING
警告: 确保 AOA 加热器或 MFP 断路器在脱漆、喷漆和处理 AOA 过程中被拉动。在遮蔽或处理前让 AOA/MFP 冷却几分钟

CAUTION: IF THE STANDARD CERTIFIED COLOR BAC 707 IS NOT TO BE USED TO RESTORE PAINT OR REPAINTING OF THE UPPER SURFACES OFTHE HORIZONTAL TAILPLANE, ELEVATOR, AILERONS, SPOILERS AND FLAPS, PLEASE CONTACT AIRBUS FOR APPROVAL OF THE NON-STANDARD PAINT COLOR.
注意: 如果水平尾翼、升降舵、副翼、扰流板和襟翼的上表面不能用 BAC 707认证的标准颜色修复或重新油漆，请与空中客车公司联系确认非标准颜色。

CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE MATERIALS, AREAS AND PARTS LISTED ARE PROPERLY PROTECTED AGAINST PAINT MATERIALS BY MASKING (RUBBER, ALL COMPOSITE PARTS, ACRYLIC MATERIALS, AERODYNAMIC SMOOTHER, METAL BONDED EDGES, ANTENNAS, PITOT PROBES, SENSORS, STATIC PORTS, ENGINE AIR INTAKE, PRECOOLER AIR OUTLET SCREEN, ENGINE EXHAUST DUCT, APU EXHAUST, APU INTAKES AND OUTLETS, AIR CONDITIONING FRESH AIR INTAKE, CABIN PRESSURIZATION CONTROL SYSTEM OUTFLOW VALVE (ZONE 172), LANDING GEARS, DOOR SEALS, ACCESS DOORS, CABIN WINDOW AND WINDSHIELD PANELS AND SEALS, ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT AND CABLES, PLASTIC MATERIALS, EXTERNAL SKIN PANEL JOINTS, HIGH STRENGTH STEEL PARTS, AVIONICS SKIN TEMPERATURE SENSOR (28HQ) SUPPORT EXTERNAL FACE) OR BY PLUGGING (DRAIN HOLES, VENTS).
注意: 确保列出的材料、区域和部件有适当的防油漆材料的遮蔽保护(橡胶、所有复合材料零件、丙烯酸材料、空气动力缓冲器、金属粘接边、天线、皮托管探头、传感器、静止端口、发动机进气口、预冷器出气屏幕、发动机排气管道、空气净化器排气口、空气净化器进气口和出气口、空气调节进气口、机舱加压控制系统出气阀(172区)、起落架、门封、出入口门、客舱窗和窗玻璃板和密封件、电气设备和 C采购产品 ABLES，塑料材料，外部皮肤面板接头，高强度钢部件，航空皮肤温度传感器(28总部)支持外部面)或通过堵塞(排水孔，通风口)。

CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE PAINT STRIPPERS DO NOT COME IN CONTACT WITH TEFLON-LINED SELF-LUBRICATED BEARINGS, ELECTRICAL TERMINAL PLUGS, NYLON-COATED WIRES AND NYLON BRUSHES. THE CHEMICALS IN THE PAINT STRIPPERS WILL ATTACK THESE ITEMS.
注意: 确保脱漆器不接触聚四氟乙烯内衬自润滑轴承、电气端子插头、尼龙涂层电线和尼龙刷。油漆剥离器里的化学物质会攻击这些东西。

CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT ALL MASKING MATERIALS ARE REMOVED FROM THE REPAIR AREA WHEN THE WORK IS COMPLETED.

注意: 确保在工作完成后将所有遮蔽材料从修复区域移除。

3. Repair of damaged top coat for metal, composite and glare parts

3.修复损坏的金属、复合材料和眩光部件的面漆

A. Before you start with the repair procedure examine the depth of the damaged area. If primer is damaged refer to Paragraph
在你开始修理程序之前，检查一下损坏区域的深度。如果底漆损坏，请参阅段落

  1. If antistatic paint on composite surfaces is damaged refer to Paragraph 5. or 6..
    复合材料表面防静电涂料如有损坏请参阅5或者6

    NOTE: This procedure can be used to repair damaged base coat+clear coat but the appearance will not be restored.
    提示: 本程序可用于修复损坏的底漆 + 清漆，但外观不会恢复。

B. Materials

B.维修材料

ITEM
项目		NOMENCLATURE
物品		QTY
数量		MATERIAL/REMARKS
资料/备注
-Cleaning agent
清洁剂		ARMaterial No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9 (Refer to CML)
物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9(请参阅 CML)
-Polyurethane primer
聚氨酯底漆		ARMaterial No. 04EAC2(Refer to CML)
物料编号04EAC2(请参阅 CML)
-Epoxy primer
环氧底漆		ARMaterial No. 04DAB2(Refer to CML)
物料编号04DAB2(参阅 CML)
-Epoxy primer
环氧底漆		ARMaterial No. 04DBA3(Refer to CML)
物料编号04DCA3(请参阅 CML)
-Epoxy primer low vac chromate free
低真空无铬环氧底漆		ARMaterial No. 04DCA3(Refer to CML)
物料编号04DCA3(请参阅 CML)
-Polyurethane top coat
聚氨酯面漆		ARAccording to Chapter 51-23-11
根据第51-23-11章
-Masking tape and paper
胶带和纸		AR
-Emery cloth
砂纸		AR320 grade
320级
-Plastic scraper
塑料刮刀		AR

C. Repair

C.维修

(1) Remove any loose paint with a plastic scraper.
（1)用塑料刮刀刮掉任何松动的油漆。

(2) Use an adhesive tape to check the adhesion of the remaining paint.

(2)用胶带检查剩余油漆的附着力。

(3) Mask off the adjacent area, which will not be treated, with masking tape and paper.

(3)用胶带和纸张遮盖邻近不会被处理的区域。

(4) Abrade the surface with emery cloth (320 grade) and chamfer the edges of the remaining paint around the damaged area.

(4)用砂布(320级)对表面进行打磨，将破损区域周围残留的油漆边缘倒角。

(5) Remove the abrasive grit, clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).
(5)除去磨料，用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洁及除油。

NOTE: Alternative solvent according to AIMS 09-00-002 can be used.
提示: 可使用 AIMS 09-00-002规定的替代溶剂。

(6) Apply epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2 or 04DBA3) or polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) or for external surface of fuselage/VTP/nacelle low voc chromate free epoxy primer (Material No. 04DCA3) to the abraded area.
(6)在磨损部位涂上环氧底漆(材料编号04DAB2或04DABA3)或聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04EAC2)或机身/VTP/吊舱无低挥发性有机化合物环氧底漆(材料编号04DCA3)的外表面。

NOTE: Make sure that the ambient temperature and the skin temperature is above 20 °C (68.0 °F) during mixing, application and curing of Material No. 04DCA3.

注意: 04DCA3材料在混合、使用和固化过程中，环境温度和表皮温度必须在20 °C (68.0 ° F)以上。

(7) Apply the appropriate polyurethane top coat (Refer to Chapter 51-23-11).
(7)涂抹适当的聚氨酯面漆(参考第51-23-11章)。

NOTE: Approved combination (Material No. 04EAC2 or 04DAB2 + 04JAA3, 04EAC2 or 04DAB2 or 04DCA3 + 04JBA3).

提示: 经批准的组合(材料编号04EAC2或04DAB2 + 04JAA3,04EAC2或04DAB2或04DCA3 + 04JBA3)。

4.Renewal of paint build-up after damage to metal and glare parts or after paint stripping of metallic and glare parts

4.在金属和眩光部件损坏或金属和眩光部件脱漆后重新涂漆

A.General

(1) You must restore the surface protection after the removal of corrosion, or a structural repair or paint stripping.

(1)清除腐蚀、结构修复或脱漆后，必须恢复表面保护。

(2) Before you start with the procedure refer to Chapter 51-23-11 and determine the required paint build-up.

(2)在开始操作程序之前，请参考第51-23-11章，并确定所需的油漆积聚量。

(3) Make sure that the internal repair parts are completely painted before they are assembled. When the parts are assembled, the fastener heads have to be reprotected with epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2) and additionally with polyurethane top coat (Material No. 04JME4) in Category C (Refer to Chapter 51-21-00).
(3)在组装前，确保内部修理部件涂满油漆。部件组装时，紧固件头必须用环氧底漆(材料号04DAB2)和C类聚氨酯面漆(材料号04JME4)重新保护(参考51-21-00章)。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1) Mask off the adjacent area, which will not be treated, with masking tape and paper.
（1)用胶带和遮蔽纸遮盖邻近不会被处理的区域。

NOTE: When you do repainting near AOA sensors, we recommend that you mask the sensors.
注意: 当您在 AOA 传感器附近重新绘制时，我们建议您遮蔽传感器。

(2)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).
（2)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to SIL 20-010.
提示: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 SIL 20-010。

NOTE: If excessive sanding or acid type paint stripper stripper (Material No. 09CBB1) has been used for paint stripping, then inspect the metal pretreatment. If the metal pretreatment, the CAA layer, is not totally removed then proceed to Paragraph
提示: 如果使用过量砂光或酸性脱漆剂(材料编号09CBB1)进行脱漆，则检查金属预处理情况。如果金属预处理，CAA 层，没有完全删除，然后继续段落4..C..(5).

(3) Pretreat the surface of the repair area in accordance with Chapter 51-21-11.

(3)按照第51-21-11章的规定对修复区域的表面进行预处理。

(4) Apply the appropriate primer as follows:
(4)按下列方法涂上适当的底漆:

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) on top of wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2).
聚氨酯底漆(材料号04EAC2)在洗涤底漆(材料号04CMA2)的顶部。

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) or epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2 or 04DMM2) or Low VOC primer (Material No. 04DBA3) on top of chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1).

- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)或环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2或04DMM2)或低挥发性有机化合物底漆(物料编号04DABA3)在化学转化涂层(物料编号10ABC1)之上。

(5) When erosion damage occurs on the wing leading edges above the pylons, the wing tips and the wing tip fences, apply:
(5)当塔架上方的机翼前缘、机翼尖端和机翼尖端围栏发生腐蚀损坏时，应:

-If the bare metal is exposed apply chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1).
- 如果裸露金属，则使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)。

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2)
- 聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04EAC2)

-Anti-erosion paint (Material No. 04PAH3)
- 防腐蚀漆(物料编号04PAH3)

-Polyurethane top coat (Refer to Chapter 51-23-11).
- 聚氨酯面漆(请参阅第51-23-11章)。

(6) Apply further layers of paint in accordance with the required paint build-up, which is given in Chapter 51-23-11.
（6)按照第51-23-11章规定的要求，再涂一层油漆。

NOTE: Make sure that previous fresh paint layers have dried for 4 hours minimum.
提示: 请确保以前的新鲜油漆层已干燥4小时以上。

The typical external paint scheme applied (except on wing box upper surfaces) is as follows:
典型的外部涂装方案(机翼盒上表面除外)如下:

-Standard: Wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) + polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) + polyurethane top coat (Material No. 04JAA3).
- 标准: 清洗底漆(材质编号04CMA2) + 聚氨酯底漆(材质编号04EAC2) + 聚氨酯面漆(材质编号04JAA3)。

- Alternate 1: Chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) on bare metal + epoxy primer (Material No. 04DMM2) + top coat (Material No. 04JMM8).
- 替代品1: 裸金属上的化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) + 环氧底漆(材料编号04DMM2) + 面漆(材料编号04JMM8)。

- Alternate 2: Chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) on bare metal + low VOC primer (Material No. 04DBA3) + low VOC top coat (Material No. 04JBA3).
- 替代品2: 裸金属上的化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) + 低挥发性有机化合物底漆(材料编号04DBA3) + 低挥发性有机化合物面漆(材料编号04JBA3)。

- Alternate 3: Chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) on bare metal + Epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2) + low VOC top coat (Material No. 04JBA3) or top coat (Material No. 04JAA3).
- 替代品3: 裸金属上的化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) + 环氧底漆(材料编号04DAB2) + 低 VOC 面漆(材料编号04JBA3)或面漆(材料编号04JAA3)。

The typical external paint scheme applied on wing box upper surfaces is as follows:
机翼箱上表面的典型外部涂装方案如下:

-Standard: wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2), polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2), elastomeric coating (Material No. 04QMF6)
- 标准: 清洗底漆(材料编号04CMA2)、聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04EAC2)、弹性涂层(材料编号04QMF6)

-Alternate 1: Wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2 only P99) + Low VOC wing coating (Material No. 04JBA6only CA8900) or
- 备选1: 清洗底漆(材料编号04CMA2只有 P99) + 低挥发性有机化合物翼层(材料编号04JBA6只有 CA8900)或

-Alternate 2: Chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) on bare surfaces + Low VOC primer (Material No. 16-060A) + Low VOC wing coating (Material No. 16-061A).
- 替代品2: 裸露表面的化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) + 低挥发性有机化合物底漆(材料编号16-060A) + 低挥发性有机化合物翼涂层(材料编号16-061A)。

-Alternate 3: Omit steps 4..C..(3)and 4..C..(4) and apply a continuos layer of wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2), structure paint primer (Material No. 04EAC2) CorD and low VOC wing coating structure paint (Material No. 04JBA6 only).
备选方案3:省略步骤4..C..(3)和步骤4..C..(4)，并连续涂一层洗涤底漆(材料号04CMA2)，结构漆底漆(材料号04EAC2) CorD和低VOC机翼涂层结构漆(材料号04JBA6)。

NOTE: The dry film thickness must be 6-8 microns (236-315 microinches) for Material No. 04CMA2, 15-25 microns (591-984 microinches) for Material No. 04EAC2) C or D and 30-50 microns (1181-1969 microinches) for Material No. 04JBA6 only.
提示：干膜厚度必须是6-8微米(236-315微英寸)的材料编号04CMA2,15-25微米(591-984微英寸)的材料编号04EAC2) C 或 D 和30-50微米(1181-1969微英寸)的材料编号04JBA6只。

NOTE: If steps 4..C..(3) and 4..C..(4) have been omitted, lightly abrade the surfaces with SCOTCH-BRITE pads and clean with lint free cloth soaked with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9 or alternative solvents according to AIMS 09-00-002). Before the application of epoxy primer (Material No. 04DMM2) or (Material No. 6-060 ) apply chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) on bare exposed aluminum parts, refer to Chapter 51-21-11, Paragraph 2. B.
提示:如果省略了步骤4..C..(3)和4..C..(4)，用SCOTCH-BRITE衬垫轻轻磨损表面，并用无绒布浸泡清洗剂(材料号08BBF1或08BAA9或根据AIMS 09-00-002的替代溶剂)进行清洁。在使用环氧底漆(材料号04DMM2)或(材料号6-060)前，应在裸露的铝件上涂上化学转化涂料(材料号10ABC1)，具体操作请参见第51-21-11章第2段。B。

NOTE: For external paint scheme use a paint system from the same manufacturer.

提示：对于外部涂料方案，使用来自同一制造商的涂料系统。

5.Renewal of paint build-up of composite components that require no anti-erosion paint

5.不需要抗侵蚀涂料的复合部件的涂料更新

A.General

(1) After a structural repair of composite components it is necessary to restore the removed0- or damaged paint layers. In case of paint damage to composites, reprotect immediately to avoid fiber erosion and water entrapment.

(1)对复合材料构件进行结构修复后，有必要恢复被移除或损坏的油漆层。如果油漆损坏复合材料，立即重新保护，以避免纤维侵蚀和水卷入。

(2) For repainting composite parts with a primer layer and/or anti-static coating in good condition you can use the procedure for metal parts as alternative.

（2）对于在良好状态下重新喷涂底漆层和/或防静电涂层的复合材料部件，您可以使用金属部件的程序作为替代。

C. Preparation

C.准备工作

(1) Remove any loose paint with a plastic scraper.

（1)用塑料刮刀刮掉任何松动的油漆。

(2) Use an adhesive tape to check the adhesion of the remaining paint.

(2)用胶带检查剩余油漆的附着力。

(3) In case of repainting, mask the surface around the touch up area, leaving an overlap of approximately 10 mm (0.394 in.) with the existing paint.
(3)在重新上漆时，将触摸区域周围的表面遮盖起来，留下大约10毫米(0.394英寸)的重叠部分用现有的油漆。

CAUTION: DO NOT DAMAGE THE FIBERS, TEDLAR FOIL (WHERE EXISTENT) OR ALUMINUM FOIL (WHERE EXISTENT) DURING THIS PROCESS.

注意: 在这个过程中不要损坏纤维，泰德拉箔(如果存在)或铝箔(如果存在)。

(4) If it is required to repaint the part completely, the remaining paint has to be abraded down to the tedlar foil (where existent) or aluminum foil (where existent) or first layer of primer on composite materials.

（4）如果需要完全重新喷漆，则必须将剩余的油漆磨损到片状箔(存在的地方)或铝箔(存在的地方)或复合材料上的第一层底漆。

(5) Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1, 08BAA9 or 08BBD1).
(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1、08BAA9或08BBD1)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: On thermoplastic parts use Material No. 08BBD1.

注: 在热塑性塑料零件上使用08BBD1号材料。

(6) Abrade the surface where the paint has peeled off from the composite with emery cloth (320 grade) or abrasive alumine powder 325 mesh or equivalent.

(6)用砂布(320级)或磨料铝粉(325目或同等物)擦拭复合材料表面脱落的涂料。

(7) Smooth down the edges of the remaining paint if necessary with emery cloth (320 grade).

(7)如有需要，用砂布(320级)将剩余油漆的边缘磨平。

(8) In case of local reprotection of damaged anti-static coating, a stripe of antistatic paint (Material No. 04PAE3 or 04QME9) 15 mm (0.591 in.) wide should be visible all around the area.
8)如需对损坏的防静电涂层进行局部再保护，则应在周围可见15毫米(0.591英寸)宽的防静电涂料条纹(材料号04PAE3或04QME9)。

NOTE: The use of antistatic paint is not necessary on to Carbonfiber Reinforced Plastic (CFRP) components.

提示: 碳纤维增强塑料(CFRP)部件不需要使用抗静电涂料。

(9) Rinse with water and carry out a water break test.

(9)用清水冲洗，并进行防水试验。

(a) Once the abrading process is complete, wash the area with water. If the water covers the area as an unbroken film, the area is clean.

(a)研磨工序完成后，用清水清洗该处。如果水覆盖该地区作为一个完整的薄膜，该地区是干净的。

(b) If the water forms small droplets on the surface this is an indication that the area is contaminated and that cleaning is not complete. In this case repeat steps 5..C..(6)thru 5..C..(9).

（b)如果水在表面形成小水滴，这表明该地区受到污染，清洁工作尚未完成。在这种情况下，重复步骤 5..C..(6)到5..C..(9).

(c) Dry the area with a clean cloth (Material No. 14SBA1) except on tedlar surface.

(c)用清洁布料(物料编号14SBA1)擦拭该处(泰勒布表面除外)。

D. Reprotection

D.重新保护

(1) Surfaces covered with aluminum foil:

(1)用铝箔覆盖的表面:

(a) Pretreat the surface of the repair area in accordance with Chapter 51-23-11.

(a)按照第51-23-11章的规定对修理区域的表面进行预处理。

(b)Apply the appropriate primer as follows:
(b)按下列方法涂上适当的底漆:

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) on top of wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2)
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)在清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)之上

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) or epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2), on top of chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1)
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)或环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2)加在化学转化涂层(物料编号10ABC1)上

-Polyurethane top coat in accordance with Chapter 51-23-11.
- 根据第51-23-11章的规定，使用聚氨酯面漆。

CAUTION: DO NOT COVER THE 15 MM (0.591 IN) WIDE STRIP OF ANTISTATIC PAINT WITH PRIMER (REFER TO RELEVANT TASK SOLUTION).
注意: 不要用底漆覆盖15毫米(0.591英寸)宽的抗静电涂料条(参考相关任务解决方案)。

(2) Surfaces covered with tedlar foil:
(2)用泰达纸箔覆盖的表面:

-Apply epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2) or Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2),
- 使用环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2)或聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2),

-antistatic paint (Material No. 04PAE3, 04QME9 or 16-030) as required,
- 所需防静电漆料(物料编号04PAE3、04QME9或16-030) ;

-polyurethane top coat in accordance with Chapter 51-23-11.
- 按照第51-23-11章的规定，使用聚氨酯面漆。

(3) CFRP (Carbonfiber Reinforced Plastic) parts:
- 按照第51-23-11章的规定，使用聚氨酯面漆。

-Apply structure paint (polyurethane primer) as a pore filler (Material No. 04FMA5) where necessary or (Material No. 04BAB5), remove excess of pore filler,
- 在有需要时使用结构漆(聚氨酯底漆)作为孔隙填充物(物料编号04FMA5)或(物料编号04BAB5) ，清除多余的孔隙填充物,

-structure paint (polyurethane primer) (Material No. 04EDA5) or 04FMA5),
- 结构漆(聚氨酯底漆)(材料编号04EDA5)或04FMA5) ,

-structure paint (polyurethane finish paint) (Material No. 04JAA3) or 04JBA3).
- 结构漆(聚氨酯面漆)(材料编号04JAA3)或04JBA3)。

(a)Alternative reprotection:
(a)替代保护:

-Apply a thin layer of primer (Material No. 04EDA5) (6 microns (236 microinches)),
- 涂上一层薄底漆(物料编号04EDA5)(6微米(236微寸)) ,

-apply pore filler as required to fill pin holes only (Material No. 04BAB5 and 04FMA5),
- 按规定使用孔隙填料填补钉孔(物料编号04BAB5及04FMA5) ;

-cure,
-治愈

-apply primer (Material No. 04EDA5 or 04FMA5),
- 使用底漆(物料编号04EDA5或04FMA5) ;

-apply polyurethane finish paint (Material No. 04JAA3 or 04JBA3).
- 使用聚氨酯面漆(材料编号04JAA3或04JBA3)。

CAUTION: DO NOT COVER THE 15 MM (0.591 IN) WIDE STRIP OF ANTISTATIC PAINT WITH PRIMER (REFER TO RELEVANT TASK SOLUTION).
注意: 不要用底漆覆盖15毫米(0.591英寸)宽的抗静电涂料条(参考相关任务解决方案)。

(4) AFRP (Aramidfiber Reinforced Plastic) or GFRP (Glassfiber Reinforced Plastic) parts:
（4)芳纶纤维增强塑料(AFRP)或玻璃纤维增强塑料(GFRP)零件:

-Apply Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04FMA5) or epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2),
- 使用聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04FMA5)或环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2),

-pore filler (Material No. 04FMA5without thinner) where necessary,
- 如有需要，使用孔隙填料(物料编号04FMA5不含稀释剂) ;

-antistatic paint (Material No. 04PAE3, 04QME9 or 16-030) as required,
- 所需防静电漆料(物料编号04PAE3、04QME9或16-030) ;

- polyurethane top coat in accordance with Chapter 51-23-11.
- 按照第51-23-11章的规定，使用聚氨酯面漆。

NOTE: To achieve a sufficient paint coverage it can be necessary to apply primer prior to top coat to avoid an overthickness of the top coat.

注意:为了获得足够的油漆覆盖，有必要在面漆之前涂底漆，以避免面漆过厚。

6.Renewal of paint build-up of composite components that require anti-erosion paint

6.更新需要抗侵蚀涂料的复合部件的油漆

A.General

(1) After a structural repair of composite components, it is necessary to restore the removed or damaged paint layers. In case of paint damage to composites, reprotect immediately to avoid fiber erosion and water entrapment.

(1)对复合材料构件进行结构修复后，需要修复被去除或损坏的涂料层。如果油漆损坏复合材料，立即重新保护，以避免纤维侵蚀和水卷入。

C. Preparation

C.准备工作

(1) Remove any loose paint with a plastic scraper.

(1)用塑料刮刀刮掉任何松动的油漆。

(2) Use an adhesive tape to check the adhesion of the remaining paint.

(2)用胶带检查剩余油漆的附着力。

(3) Mask off the adjacent area, which will not be treated, with masking tape and paper.
(3)用胶带和纸张遮盖邻近不会被处理的区域。

CAUTION: DO NOT DAMAGE THE FIBERS DURING THIS PROCESS.

注意: 在此过程中不要损坏纤维。

(4) If it is required to repaint the part completely, the remaining paint has to be abraded down to the basic primer.

(4)如果需要完全重新上漆，剩余的油漆必须磨损到基本底漆。

(5) Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1, 08BAA9 or 08BBD1).

(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1、08BAA9或08BBD1)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

(6) In case of partial repainting, mask the surface around the repair area, leaving an overlap of approximately 10 mm (0.394 in.) with the existing paint.

(6)在部分重新上漆的情况下，遮盖修复区域周围的表面，留下大约10毫米(0.394英寸)的重叠部分用现有的油漆。

(7) Abrade the surface where the paint has peeled off from the composite with abrasive alumine powder 325 mesh or equivalent.

(7)用325目或等效的磨料铝粉擦拭从复合材料上剥落的涂料表面。

(8) Smooth down the edges of the remaining paint if necessary with emery cloth grade 320.

(8)如有需要，用320级砂布将剩余油漆的边缘磨平。

(9) In case of local reprotection, abrade the adjacent areas until a strip of antistatic paint (Material No. 04PAE3 or 04QME9) 15 mm (0.591 in.) wide shows around the area.
在局部重新保护的情况下，磨损邻近区域，直到在该区域周围出现15毫米(0.591英寸)宽的防静电涂料条(材料号04PAE3或04QME9)。

NOTE: The use of antistatic paint is not necessary on CFRP (Carbonfiber Reinforced Plastic) components.
提示: 碳纤维增强塑料(CFRP)部件不需要使用抗静电涂料。

(10) Rinse with water and carry out a water break test.

（10)用清水冲洗，并进行破水试验。

(a) Once the abrading process is complete, wash the area with water. If the water covers the area as an unbroken film, the area is clean.

a)研磨工序完成后，用清水清洗该处。如果水覆盖该地区作为一个完整的薄膜，该地区是干净的。

(b) If the water forms small droplets on the surface this is an indication that the area is contaminated and that cleaning is not complete. In this case repeat steps 6..C..(6) thru 6..C..(10)

(b)如果水在表面形成小水滴，这表明该地区受到污染，清洁工作尚未完成。在这种情况下，重复步骤.6..C..(6) 到 6..C..(10)

(c) Degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1).

(c)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1)清洗表面。

D. Reprotection

D. 重新保护

CAUTION: DO NOT COVER THE 15 MM (0.591 IN) WIDE STRIP OF ANTISTATIC PAINT WITH PRIMER (REFER TO RELEVANT TASK SOLUTION).

注意: 不要用底漆覆盖15毫米(0.591英寸)宽的抗静电涂料条(参考相关任务解决方案)。

(1) Apply Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04FMA5).
(1)应用聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04FMA5)。

(2) Apply pore filler (Material No. 04FMA5 without thinner) where necessary and abrade.

(2)必要时使用孔隙填料(材料编号04FMA5，不含稀释剂) ，并进行打磨。

(3) Apply antistatic paint (Material No. 04PAE3 or 04QME9) if necessary.

(3)如有需要，涂上防静电漆(物料编号04PAE3或04QME9)。

(4) Mask countersunk holes with masking tape for conductivity reasons.

(4)由于导电原因，使用掩蔽胶带掩蔽沉孔。

(5) Apply anti-erosion paint (Material No. 04PAH3) in ram area as required.
(5)按要求在闸板区域涂上防腐蚀漆(物料编号04PAH3)。

NOTE: Ram area is that area designated as being most directly opposed to the airflow.

提示:闸板区域是指与气流最直接相对的区域。

(6) Apply polyurethane top coat in accordance with Chapter 51-23-11.
(6)按照第51-23-11章的规定涂抹聚氨酯面漆。

NOTE: To achieve a sufficient paint coverage it can be necessary to apply primer prior to top coat to avoid an overthickness to the top coat.
注意: 为了达到足够的油漆覆盖率，可能需要在顶层涂料之前使用底漆，以避免顶层涂料过厚。

7.Repair of peeled-off paint coatings on fastener heads

7. 紧固件头部剥落的油漆涂层的修复

A. General

(1) If you find peeled-off paint coatings on fastener heads, it is often the result of corrosion or poor paint adhesion, which breaks the surface protection.

(1)如果在紧固件头部发现剥落的油漆涂层，这往往是由于腐蚀或油漆附着力差，破坏了表面保护。

(2) Therefore it is necessary to examine the fastener and the adjacent area for corrosion damage. If you find corrosion, refer to Chapter 51-74-00 and Chapter 51-43-00 for removal of corrosion and oversize replacement.

(2)因此有必要对紧固件及其附近区域进行腐蚀损伤检查。如果您发现腐蚀，请参阅第51-74-00章和第51-43-00章，以便清除腐蚀和更换超大尺寸。

(3) Before you start with the procedure refer to Chapter 51-23-11 and determine the required paint build-up.
(3)在开始操作程序之前，请参考第51-23-11章，并确定所需的油漆积聚量。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1) Mask off the adjacent area, which will not be treated, with masking tape and paper.
(1)用胶带和纸张遮盖邻近不会被处理的区域。

(2) Remove and abrade the loose, broken paint layers with emery cloth until the surface is smooth.

(2)用砂布擦去松散破损的油漆层，直至表面光滑。

(3) Remove the abrasive grit and degrease the surface of the repair area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).
(3)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9)清除磨粒并去除修理区域表面的油脂。

NOTE: Alternative solvent according to AIMS 09-00-002 can be used.
提示: 可使用 AIMS 09-00-002规定的替代溶剂。

(4) If the components and fasteners are made of aluminum alloy, apply chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1). Other materials have only to be slightly abraded with Scotchbrite pads.

(4)如果部件和紧固件是铝合金制成的，应用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)。其他材料只需用百洁布（）轻微研磨即可。

(5) Apply epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2).

(5)应用环氧底漆(材料编号04DAB2)。

(6) Apply the final paint system according to Chapter 51-23-11.

(6)根据第51-23-11章使用最终涂料系统。

8.Application of anti erosion tape on vertical and horizontal stabilizer painted leading edge

8. 防腐胶带在水平和垂直稳定器涂装前沿上的应用（垂尾和平尾，小翼）

A.General

CAUTION: REMOVE THE ANTI−EROSION TAPE WHEN COMMUNICATION AND NAVIGATION SYSTEMS ARE ALTERED.

警告: 当通讯和导航系统发生变化时，请移除防腐胶带。

(1)Anti-erosion tape may be used as a preventive measure against paint erosion or as a temporary repair solution.

(1)防侵蚀胶带可作为防止油漆侵蚀的预防措施或作为临时修理的解决方案。

(2)In case of paint damage to composites, reprotect immediately to avoid fiber erosion and water entrapment.

(2)复合材料如发生油漆损坏，应立即重新进行保护，以防止纤维腐蚀和积水。

(3)The tape can be temporarily directly on top of the fibers, provided the surface is abraded to smooth down the paint edges.

(3)可暂时将胶带直接贴在纤维顶部，只要表面磨损以使涂料边缘平滑即可。

(4)In case of erosion, which caused damage to the fiber, the structure must be repaired to restore the outside contour and structural integrity before tape application.

(4)如发生侵蚀，造成纤维损伤，应在使用胶带前对结构进行修复，以恢复外部轮廓和结构完整性。

(5)Fresh finish (top coat or varnish) shall be cured minimum for 24 hours before tape application.

(5)新漆面完成(面漆或清漆)应固化至少24小时之前，磁带应用。

C.Preparation of Leading Edges for Tape Application

C.胶带前缘的准备

(1)Cut the polyurethane tape to the required length, refer to Figure 010.

(1)将聚氨酯胶带切割至所需长度，请参阅图010。

(2)Do not remove the release paper from the polyurethane tape. Put this tape in position on the leading edge.

(2)不要将离型纸从聚氨酯胶带上取下，将胶带放在胶带前缘的位置。

(3)Fix the polyurethane tape in position with adhesive tape and mark the area.

(3)用胶带将聚氨酯胶带固定在合适的位置，并标记面积。

(4)Enlarge the marked area on each side by approximately 5 mm (0.2 in.) longitudinal direction and mask off the area with an adhesive tape, refer to Figure 006.

(4)将两边的标记面积增大约5毫米(0.2英寸)纵向方向，并用胶带遮盖该区域，请参阅图006。

Figure 006 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Application of Anti - erosion Tape

(5)Remove the polyurethane tape subsequent to masking and marking.

(5)遮蔽和标记后拆卸聚氨酯胶带。

(6)Lightly abrade the application area with dry abrasive sand.

(6)用干磨砂布轻轻擦拭涂敷区域。

(7)Remove the sanding residues and clean with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1, 08BAA9 or 08BBD1).

(7)除去磨砂残余物，并用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1、08BAA9或08BBD1)清洗。

D.Tape Application

D.胶带应用

Apply self-adhesive transparent polyurethane tape to leading edges as follows:

在前缘使用不干胶透明聚氨酯胶带如下:

(1)Immediately after cleaning, however only after the complete evaporation of the cleaning agent (allow 20 to 30 minutes for evaporation then wipe the area with a clean absorbent cloth to avoid any condensation), place the adhesive tape with release paper in final position on the leading edges. Tack along the full length on both sides.

(1)清洁完毕后，但只可在清洁剂完全蒸发后(预留20至30分钟的蒸发时间，然后用清洁的吸水布擦拭该区域，以避免凝结) ，立即将带有脱模纸的胶带放置在前缘的最后位置。在两边沿全长钉住。
****。

(2)Gradually remove the adhesive tacking on one side and peel off an approximately 50 mm (2.0 in.) wide strip of release paper from the polyurethane tape, refer to Figure 007.

(2)逐渐移除一面的粘合剂，并剥去约50毫米(2.0英寸)从聚氨酯胶带释放纸宽带，参见图007。

(3)Slightly press the polyurethane tape against the leading edge.

(3)将聚氨酯胶带轻轻压在前缘上。

Figure 007 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Application of Anti-erosion Tape

Figure 008 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Application of Anti-erosion Tape

Figure 009 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Application of Anti-erosion Tape

(4)Remove the adhesive tacking on the opposite side and turn up the polyurethane tape. Peel off the remaining release paper, refer to Figure 008.
(4)取下对面的胶粘剂粘合剂，将聚氨酯胶带卷起。剥离剩余的释放纸，参见图008。

CAUTION: DO NOT STRETCH THE POLYURETHANE ANTI−EROSION TAPE DURING APPLICATION.

注意: 在使用过程中不要拉伸聚氨酯防腐带。

(5)Gradually press the polyurethane anti-erosion tape against the leading edge, refer to Figure 009.

(5)逐渐将聚氨酯防腐胶带压向前缘，参见图009。

(6)Check if the polyurethane tape has been applied without the formation of bubbles.
(6)检查聚氨酯胶带是否在使用过程中没有形成气泡。

CAUTION: DO NOT APPLY EXCESSIVE PRESSURE.

注意: 不要施加过大的压力。

(7)If necessary, carefully squeeze out any trapped air using a plastic spatula or roller.

(7)如有需要，用塑胶刮刀或滚筒小心挤出积聚的空气。

(8)Allow bonding of the tape to cure for at least 1 hour at a minimum temperature of 15 °C (59. °F).

（8）允许粘接胶带在15°C(59°C)的最低温度下固化至少1小时。°F)。

Figure 010 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Application of Anti-erosion Tape

9.Renewal of damaged fuel tank top coating on center tank and horizontal stabilizer center tank

A.In the event of a fuel leak from the center tank (Section 21) or the horizontal stabilizer-center tank it is necessary to renew the external coating (Material No. 16-015), as well as the internal sealing in the area of the leak. Refer to Chapter 51-76-12 for information concerning the internal sealing.

如果中心油箱(第21节)或水平稳定器中心油箱发生燃油泄漏，必须更新外部涂层(材料编号16-015) ，以及泄漏区域的内部密封胶。有关内部密封胶的信息，请参阅第51-76-12章。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Remove the fuel tank top coating (Material No. 16-015 ) from around the area of the fuel leak by abrading. Use abrasive cloth/paper 100 grade and finish with 240 grade or finer. Chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.
(1)通过研磨将燃油箱顶部涂层(材料16-015)从燃油泄漏区域周围除去。使用磨料布/纸100级和完成与240级或更细。将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使其光滑。

NOTE: It is necessary to remove the paint down to the metal surface to ensure good adhesion of the new paint coat.

注意: 为了确保新漆层的良好附着力，有必要将漆层移至金属表面。

(2)Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).
(2)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洁擦伤及周围地方。

NOTE: Alternative solvent according to AIMS 09-00-002 can be used.

提示: 可使用 AIMS 09-00-002规定的替代溶剂。

(3)Mask off the area that is to be repainted.

(3)将要重新粉刷的地方遮盖起来。

(4) Apply wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) to the exposed metal surface, allow wash primer to dry for a minimum of 1 hour but not exceeding 24 hours or apply Chemical Conversion Coating (Material No. 10ABC1) (Refer to Chapter 51-21-11).

(4)在外露的金属表面涂上清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2) ，让清洗底漆干燥至少1小时但不超过24小时，或涂上化学转化涂层(物料编号10ABC1)(参阅第51-21-11章)。

(5)On top of Chemical Conversion Coating (Material No. 10ABC1) apply Primer Coating Epoxy (Material No. 04DAB2) to the area including any fastener heads, or apply Polyurethane Primer (Material No. 04EAC2) on top of Wash Primer (Material No. 04CMA2). Allow to dry under ambient conditions for a minimum of 2 hours but not exceeding 24 hours.
(5)在化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)之上，在包括紧固件头部的地方涂上底漆涂层环氧树脂(材料编号04DAB2) ，或在清洗底漆(材料编号04CMA2)之上涂上聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04EAC2)。允许在环境条件下干燥至少2小时，但不超过24小时。

CAUTION: THE AREA THAT IS TO BE REMASKED SHOULD ENSURE THAT THE FUEL TANK COATING THAT IS TO BE APPLIED IS NOT IN CONTACT WITH ANY OTHER EXISTING PAINT FINISH EXCEPT THE EPOXY PRIMER OR EXISTING FUEL TANK COATING.
警告: 应重新遮蔽的区域应确保将要涂覆的油箱涂层除了环氧底漆或现有的油箱涂层外，不与任何其他现有的油漆涂层接触。

(6)Remove masking tape and paper, remask the area to include an overlap on to the existing fuel tank coating (Material No. 16-015 or 09-032), but observe the CAUTION given above.

(6)除去遮蔽胶带及纸张，重新遮蔽现有燃料箱涂层(材料编号16-015或09-032)上的重叠部分，但须遵守上述注意事项。

(7)Apply fuel tank coating (Material No. 16-015 or 09-032) with a soft hair brush as follows:
(7)用软毛刷在燃料箱涂层(材料编号16-015或09-032)上涂抹如下:

- 2 coats on horizontal surfaces
在水平面上涂2层

- 3 coats on vertical surfaces.
- 在垂直表面上涂3层。

After each coat has dried for approximately 15 minutes, smooth out by brush any bubbles or runs.
在每一层涂料干燥大约15分钟后，用刷子把任何气泡或痕迹都刷平。

Allow 3 to 4 hours drying time under ambient conditions between coats. This time can be reduced to 2 hours if forced drying is
used.
允许3至4小时的干燥时间在环境条件下的涂层之间。如果使用强制干燥，这个时间可以减少到2小时。

NOTE: Final paint thickness should be 300 to 400 microns (11811 to 15748 microinches).

提示：最终油漆厚度应为300至400微米(11811至15748微英寸)。

(8) Allow a final drying time of 24 hours under ambient conditions.

在环境条件下允许最终干燥时间为24小时。

10. Renewal of external paint build-up with AMS 3095 external paint scheme

10. 用 AMS 3095外部涂料方案更新外部涂料

A. General

NOTE: Do not renew with AMS 3095 for the following parts:
提示: 不要为下列部件更换 AMS3095:

- Radome,
雷达罩,整流罩

- Antennas,
天线,

- All areas covered with anti-erosion coating.
- 所有覆盖有防腐蚀涂层的地方。

NOTE: The maximum recommended paint thickness is 350 and 400 microns on nacelles.
提示: 机舱的最大推荐油漆厚度为350微米和400微米。

NOTE: Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted areas must not exceed 400 microns.
提示: 在静压孔和皮托管探针(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的距离不得超过400微米。

NOTE: If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded, this can cause electrical discharge, which can interfere with communication and navigation systems.
提示: 如果超过推荐的涂料厚度，可能会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

CAUTION: THIS PROCEDURE IS NOT APPLICABLE TO THE RADOME AND ANTENNAS, AND IS NOT RECOMMENDED FOR THE UPPER WING BOX.

注意: 本程序不适用于雷达罩（整流罩）和天线，不推荐用于翼盒上。

(1) This procedure is applicable after complete paint stripping according to Chapter 51-75-11.

(1)根据第51-75-11章，本程序适用于完成油漆脱漆后。

(2) The work consists in applying an external paint scheme qualified according to AMS 3095 instead of AIRBUS approved external paint scheme on external surfaces only.

(2)这项工作包括采用根据 AMS 3095认证的外部涂料方案，而不是只在外部表面采用 AIRBUS 认证的外部涂料方案。

(3) Before you start with the procedure refer to Chapter 51-23-11 and determine the required paint build-up.

(3)在开始操作程序之前，请参考第51-23-11章，并确定所需的油漆积聚量。

(4) For horizontal composite surfaces ensure that the top coat color requirements are met, contact AIRBUS.

(4)对于水平复合材料表面，确保满足表面涂层颜色要求，联系 AIRBUS。

11.Renewal of external paint coatings of Navigation and Communication Antennas.

11. 更新导航和通信天线外涂层。

A.General

(1)As a consequence of the aggressive environmental conditions an aircraft is likely to encounter during its normal live - sand storms, ash clouds, washing products, skydrol leaks, air erosion - may lead to a progressive degradation of the paint applied to the various antennas at the time of their manufacture.
(1)由于飞机在正常使用过程中可能遇到的恶劣环境条件——沙尘暴、灰云、洗涤产品、空中滴漏、空气侵蚀——可能导致制造时涂在各种天线上的油漆逐渐退化。

(2)The certification of a given antenna on AIRBUS aircraft is achieved when the electrical performances of its initial definition (i.e. with paint applied during manufacture) are demonstrated to meet the applicable design requirements, such as ARINC, RTCA recommendations or AIRBUS specification (RF, antistatic, aerodynamic and size) Therefore some antennas are not allowed to be repainted in-house. It shall be emphasized that inappropriate in-house rework of antennas may downgrade their performance, thereby affecting their certified definition.

2)空客飞机上给定天线的认证是在其初始定义的电气性能(即在制造过程中使用的油漆)被证明符合适用的设计要求时实现的，例如ARINC, RTCA建议或空客规范(RF，抗静电，空气动力学和尺寸)。因此，一些天线不允许在内部重新涂漆。需要强调的是，不适当的天线内部返工可能会降低其性能，从而影响其认证清晰度。

(3)In-house painting is not allowed for the following antennas (Refer to vendor’s CMM).

(3)下列天线不允许在内部喷漆(参考供应商的三坐标测量机)。

(a)Navigation antennas.
(a)导航天线。

C.修复

(1) Repair of ATA 34-50: ATC-DME antennas leading edge erosion from CHELTON (F6175) former RAYAN (F6987) - DORNE&MARGOLIN (85226).
(1)修复 ATA 34-50: ATC-DME 天线从切尔顿(F6175)前 RAYAN (F6987)-DORNE & MARGOLIN (85226)引起的边缘侵蚀。

CHELTON (F6175) former RAYAN (F6987) - DORNE&MARGOLIN (85226).Blade shaped antennas are, by design, subject to erosion of their leading edge, and may require subsequent paint rework. In case of paint erosion, the antennas may be repainted on their leading edges. For this purpose, the antenna area where paint application is possible is given in Figure 012 and Figure 013.

切尔顿(F6175)前瑞安(F6987)-多恩 & 马戈林(85226)。叶片形状的天线，按照设计，容易受到侵蚀的前缘，并可能需要随后的油漆返工。在油漆侵蚀的情况下，天线的前缘可以重新油漆。为此，图012和图013给出了可以喷漆的天线区域。

(a) Use abrasive cloth/paper 240 grade or finer to prepare the surface and chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.
(a)使用240级或较细的砂布/纸张预备表面，并将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使表面光滑。

NOTE: It is necessary to remove the paint down to the metal surface to ensure a good adhesion of the paint coat.

提示: 为了确保涂层具有良好的附着力，有必要将涂层移至金属表面。

(b) Clean the repair area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BAA9).

(b)用清洁剂(物料编号08BAA9)清洁维修范围。

(c) Apply structure paint (Material No. 04JAA3 or (Material No. 04JBA3).
(c)应用结构漆(材料编号04JAA3或(材料编号04JBA3)。

The thickness of the applied paint layer must not exceed 350 microns (13780 microinches). It has also be of the same color as the original. Fot the color, refer to the standards given in the CMM for each Antenna Part Number.
涂层厚度不得超过350微米(13780微英寸)。它的颜色也和原来的一样。关于颜色，请参考 CMM 中给出的每个天线部件号的标准。

NOTE: However, if the operator elects to paint in-house their antennas, the limitations of the CMM with regard to the physical condition of antenna, apply. In particular, any antenna showing paint cracks or any other physical damage must be removed and shall not be repainted.
提示: 然而，如果操作员选择在内部喷漆他们的天线，三坐标测量机有关天线的物理条件的局限性，适用。特别是，任何显示油漆裂缝或任何其他物理损坏的天线必须拆除，不得重新油漆。

NOTE: In addition, in order to prevent erosion, a possible solution is given in paragraph 12..
提示:另外，为了防止侵蚀，第12段给出了一个可能的解决方案。

(2)Repair of communication antennas ATA 23-11: HF Antennas.

1 Remove the corrosion by abrading. Use abrasive cloth/paper 100 grade and finish with 240 grade.

1通过研磨来消除腐蚀。使用100级的砂布/纸，并用240级的砂布完成。

7取下遮蔽胶带。

For this purpose, the antenna area where paint application is possible is given in Figure Figure 014 and Figure 015.

根据设计，叶片形天线的前缘容易受到侵蚀，并且可能需要随后的油漆返工，在油漆侵蚀的情况下，天线的前缘可能会被重新油漆。为此，图014和图015给出了可以喷漆的天线区域。

(b) Use abrasive cloth/paper 240 grade o0r finer to prepare the surface and chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.
(b)使用240级或较细的砂布/纸张预备表面，并将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使表面光滑。

(c) Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 16-026). Apply top coat (Material No. 08AEB1 or 04JBA3). The thickness of the applied paint layer must not exceed 350 microns (13780 microinches). It has also to be of the same color as the original. For the color refer to the standards given in the CMM for each antenna part number.
(c)用清洁剂(物料编号16-026)清洁磨损的地方及周围地方。应用面漆(材料编号08AEB1或04JBA3)。涂层厚度不得超过350微米(13780微英寸)。它也必须是原来的一样的颜色。对于颜色，请参考 CMM 中给出的每个天线零件编号的标准。

NOTE: However, if the operator selects to paint in-house their antennas, the limitation of the CMM with regards to the physical condition of the antenna, apply. In particular, any antenna showing paint cracks or any other physical damage must be removed and shall not be re-painted.

提示: 然而，如果操作员选择在内部喷漆他们的天线，三坐标测量机在天线的物理条件方面的限制适用。特别是，任何显示油漆裂缝或任何其他物理损坏的天线必须拆除，不得重新油漆。

(4) Application of Fluorescent Paint on ATC-DME-VHF antennas.
(4)荧光涂料在ATC-DME-VHF天线上的应用。

Antennas protruding fro the lower fuselage ATC-DME-VHF systems) can be damaged by movement of ground personnel therefore fluorescent paint can be applied on specific areas of those antennas fins.

从下机身伸出的天线(ATC-DME-VHF系统)可能被地面人员的移动损坏，因此可以在这些天线鳍的特定区域涂上荧光漆。

(a) Lightly abrade the areas to be painted with SCOTCH-BRITE pads, refer to Figure 012, Figure 013, Figure 014 and Figure 015.

(a)用百洁布衬垫轻轻打磨待涂区域，参见图012、图013、图014和图015。

(b) Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).

(b)用清洗剂(物料号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洗磨损及周围区域。

(c) Apply fluorescent paint in 2 layers: CA8000 white M8001 100 microns (3937 microinches (Material No. 04JBA3)) then CA8000E03613 yellow fluor 60 microns (2362 microinches (Material No. 04JBA3)).
(c)分两层涂荧光漆:CA8000 white M8001 100微米(3937微英寸(材料号04JBA3))和 CA8000 E03613 黄色荧光 60微米(2362微英寸(材料号04JBA3))

NOTE: The fluorescent paint to be used must be no-conductive and applied with a maximum layer thickness of 350 microns (13780 microinches).
提示:要使用的荧光漆必须是不导电的，并且应用的最大层厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)。

12. Application of ANTI-EROSION Tape on VHF, ATC/DME Antennas.

12.抗腐蚀胶带在VHF、ATC/DME天线上的应用。

A.General

(1) The concerned antennas are the VHF, and ATC/DME antennas. The application of polyurethane adhesive tape on these blade type antennas is authorized if the antenna area where the radiating element is located, is not covered. Refer to Figure 012, Figure 013, Figure 014 and Figure 015.
(1)有关的天线为甚高频天线和 ATC/DME 天线。如果辐射元件所在的天线区域没有被覆盖，授权在这些刀片型天线上使用聚氨酯胶带。请参阅图012、图013、图014和图015。

CAUTION: IN CASE OF APPLICATION OF SUCH A TAPE ON THE LEADING EDGE OF THESE ANTENNAS, PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THIS COULD BE THE ORIGIN OF MICRO ELECTRO-STATIC DISCHARGES OF THE ANTENNAS. IN SUCH A CASE, THE ELECTRO-STATIC DISCHARGES COULD RESULT IN NOISE. THEREFORE, IF THE FLIGHT CREW REPORTS STATIC NOISE ON THE VHF AFTER APPLICATION OF THE ADHESIVE TAPE, WE RECOMMEND THE OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS TAPE.

注意:如果在这些天线的前缘应用这种胶带，请注意这可能是天线微静电放电的来源。在这种情况下，静电放电会产生噪音。因此，如果机组人员在使用胶带后报告VHF上有静电噪音，我们建议操作员拆除该胶带。

(2) This procedure is not recommended for all other type of antennas (Radio Altimeter, TCAS, GPS, SATCOM, ADF for example).

(2)此程序不推荐用于所有其他类型的天线(例如无线电高度表、 TCAS、 GPS、 SATCOM、 ADF)。

C. Procedure

C.程序

(1) Remove the AOA plate, refer to AMM Chapter 34-11-19-000-001-A (only paint the AOA plate).

(1)拆卸 AOA 牌照，请参阅 AMM 章34-11-19-000-001-A (只涂 AOA 牌照)。

(2) Mask off holes and markings with self adhesive aluminium tape (Material No. 05RAB9).

(2)用铝胶带遮盖洞口及标记(物料编号05RAB9)。

(3)Remove the paint, refer to Chapter 51-75-11.

(3)去掉油漆，参照第51-75-11章。

(4)Remove the self adhesive aluminium tape.

(4)拆铝胶带。

(5)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or Material No. 08BAA9 or Material No. 08BBD1).
(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或物料编号08BAA9或物料编号08BBD1)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

提示: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(6) Mask off areas which will not be repainted (holes and markings) with masking tape/paper.

(6)用胶带或纸张遮盖不会重新油漆的地方(洞及标记)。

(7)Apply the appropriate primer as follows:
(7)按下列方法涂上适当的底漆:

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) on top of wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2).
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)在清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)之上。

NOTE: No wash primer required if no bare metal exposed.
提示: 如果没有裸露的金属，则不需要清洗底漆。

- Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) or epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2) or low VOC primer (Material No. 04DBA3) on top of chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1).
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)或环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2)或低挥发性有机化合物底漆(物料编号04DABA3)加在化学转化涂层(物料编号10ABC1)上。

(8)Apply polyurethane top coat grey BAC 707 (Material No. 04JAA3 or Material No. 04JBA3) for post modification 153214 and modification 153213 conical plates or post modification 154862 new flat plates removed from the aircraft. And Material No. 04JAA3with livery color for old plate old flat blanking plates (P/N D3411007620000 or D3411013520000).

(8)在后改装153214及后改装153213块锥形板或后改装154862块新平板时，采用聚氨酯面层灰色的 BAC707(材料编号04JAA3或材料编号04JBA3)。材料编号04JAA3，涂装颜色，适用于老板旧平板下料(P/N D3411007620000或 D3411013520000)。

(9)Remove the masking tape/paper.

(9)除去遮蔽胶带/纸张。

(10)Make sure that one hole for electrical bonding is free from paint.

(10)确保一个电子连接孔没有油漆。

(11) Install the AOA sensor, refer to AMM Chapter 34-11-19-400-001-A.

(11)安装 AOA 传感器，请参阅 AMM 第34-11-19-400-001-A 章。

(12)Paint fasteners according to 7 . technique (Repair of peeled-off paint coatings on fastener heads).
(12)按 7 .涂装紧固件。技术(紧固件头油漆涂层剥落修复)。

NOTE: If marks of paint are noticed on the AOA vane, clear them off very carefully using Material No. 09EBA1 or 09EBB1 or 09BBB1 (Strippers) and a Material No. 14SBA1 (Lint-free cotton cloth). Do not use metallic tools or abrasive paper.
提示: 如果注意到 AOA 叶片上的油漆痕迹，使用材料号09EBA1或09EBB1或09BBB1(剥离器)和材料号14SBA1(无绒棉布)非常小心地清除它们。不要使用金属工具或研磨纸。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Remove completely the airline finish with abrasive paper grade 240 or finer and chamfer the edges of the remaining paint around the damaged area, if required.
(1)用240级或更细的砂纸完全去除飞机漆，如果需要，将剩余油漆的边缘在损坏区域周围倒角。

(2)Remove the abrasive grit.

(2)除去磨粒。

(3)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBD1)清洁及除油。

(4)用遮蔽胶带/遮蔽纸遮蔽邻近不会被处理的地方。

(5)Apply airline finish, top coat (Material No. 04JAA3), or Material No. 04JBA3), or base/clear coat (Material No. 04LDA3 and Material No. 04MDA3. Do not overlap or stack different colors.

(5)涂抹面漆、面漆(材料编号04JAA3)、面漆(材料编号04JBA3)或底漆/透明漆(材料编号04LDA3和材料编号04MDA3)。不要重叠或堆叠不同的颜色。

(6)Remove the masking tape/masking taper.

(6)拆下遮蔽胶带/遮蔽纸。

(7)检查油漆厚度，参考第1..B段。或者在考试券上。

15.Renewal of external Paint Build-up on Fuselage with intermediate Coat Paint Scheme.

15.用中间涂层方案更新机身外部油漆

CAUTION: THIS PROCEDURE IS NOT APPLICABLE TO THE RADOME AND TO ANTENNAS.

注意: 本程序不适用于天线罩和天线。

A.General

NOTE: Do not renew with intermediate coat for the following parts:
提示: 以下部分不要用中间涂层更换:

-Radome
-雷达天线罩

-Antennas
-天线

-Wing, HTP
-小翼, HTP

-Leading edge of vertical stabilizer
- 垂直尾翼前缘

NOTE: The maximum recommended paint thickness is 350 microns (13780 microinches) and 400 microns (15748 microinches) on the nacelles.
注意:机舱的最大推荐油漆厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)和400微米(15748微英寸)。

Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted areas must not exceed 400 microns (15748 microinches).
在静态端口（静压孔）和皮托管探头(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的步长不得超过400微米(15748微英寸)。

If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded it can cause electrical discharge, which can interfere with communication and navigation systems.

如果超过建议的涂料厚度，就会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

(1) This procedure is applicable after complete paint stripping, refer to Chapter 51-57-11.
